Title: The Story of Woo Viet
Events depicted: The story features Woo Viet , who wants to leave his country , Vietnam , behind and start over in the United States

Title: Boat People
Events depicted: The Fall of Saigon and its aftermath

Title: The Killing Fields ( film )
Events depicted: The Killing Fields is a 1984 British biographical drama film about the Khmer Rouge regime in Cambodia , which is based on the experiences of two journalists : Cambodian Dith Pran and American Sydney Schanberg

Title: Turtle Beach ( film )
Events depicted: Judith , an Australian photojournalist ( Greta Scacchi ) , leaves her family to cover the story of Vietnamese boat people in a Malaysian refugee camp . There she befriends Minou , a Vietnamese streetwalker ( Joan Chen ) , who has married a diplomat and together they try to bring awareness to the terrible conditions suffered by the people there

Title: Green Dragon
Events depicted: The experiences of Vietnamese refugees in the United States immediately following the end of the war

Title: The Beautiful Country
Events depicted: A Vietnamese boy ( Damien Nguyen ) goes to the US to search for his father , an American ex-soldier

Title: Sống trong sợ hãi ( Living in Fear )
Events depicted: A Vietnamese farmer is supporting two families after the end of the war - one in the north , which he abandoned after fleeing during the war , and his new family in the south . To get enough money he sets on to re-cultivate a field full of mines . His life and psyche is changing while he removes each mine by himself

Title: Journey from the Fall
Events depicted: Vietnamese experience of post-war re-education camps and life as refugees

Title: The Gate ( 2014 film )
Events depicted: The Gate ( French : Le Temps des aveux ) is a 2014 French-Belgian-Cambodian drama film directed by Régis Wargnier , based on the books by François Bizot

Title: First They Killed My Father ( film )
Events depicted: First They Killed My Father ( Khmer : មុនដំបូងខ្មែរក្រហមសម្លាប់ប៉ារបស់ខ្ញុំ Moun dambaung Khmer Krahm samleab ba robsa khnhom ) is a 2017 Cambodian-American Khmer biographical historical thriller film directed by Angelina Jolie and written by Jolie and Loung Ung , based on Ung 's memoir of the same name . Set in 1975 , the film depicts 7-year-old Ung who is forced to be trained as a child soldier while her siblings are sent to labor camps during the Communist Khmer Rouge regime
